info.game_comments: 2005 Ultimate Tournament of Champions Round 1, game 29.

jeopardy_round: I'LL HAVE A SUB TO GO

(1, 1).clue: In 1998 Congress designated this Little Rock high school a National Historic Site

(3, 1).clue: In WWII, Germany built more than 1,100 of these subs; more than half were sunk at sea

(4, 1).clue: If you're using the ol' bean, you're using this

(5, 1).clue: Roy Blunt of Missouri is the majority one in the House of Representatives

(6, 1).clue: (Cheryl of the Clue Crew shuffles uphill on skis in Park City, UT.)  As well as a suit pattern, it's a technique of climbing a hill by pointing your skis outward

(2, 2).clue: The legal instrument to spring you after an arrest

(6, 2).clue: In this type of skiing that includes moguls, shorter poles are used for maneuverability

(5, 3).clue: A cord used on laundry day in sunny weather

(6, 3).clue: It's the sound of the skis bouncing rapidly off hard snow--keep your knees & ankles flexed to make it shut up

(2, 4).clue: In Internet domain names, this country of the West Indies

(3, 4).correct response: Twenty Thousand Leagues Under the Sea (by Jules Verne)

(5, 5).clue: It precedes "Monaco" in this name of a brand owned by Ralph Lauren

(6, 5).clue: (Cheryl of the Clue Crew skids to a stop on skis in Park City, UT.)  Introduced in 1868, this turn that ski jumpers use to stop is named for what Norway's capital was then called

(1, 1).clue: He was ordained a priest in 1507 & in 1508 became an instructor of philosophy at the University of Wittenberg

(2, 1).clue: "Belle" & "Be Our Guest" were nominated, too, but it was this film's title song that won the Oscar
